track.name: Algorithms

primary_contest.description: Join OpenBracket CodeSprint beginning October 15th to solve challenges, win 50,000 USD in cash prizes and prove your skills to companies hiring like Microsoft, JPMorgan Chase, Capital One and more! This is a 48 hour competition. First place wins $10,000 and 50 winners win a round trip ticket to Delaware to compete for an onsite competition.

model.name: Making Candies
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function minimumPasses($m, $w, $p, $n) {
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%li %li %li %li", $m, $w, $p, $n);
$result = minimumPasses($m, $w, $p, $n);
echo $result . "\n";

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

def minimumPasses(m, w, p, n)
    # Complete this function
end

m, w, p, n = gets.strip.split(' ')
m = m.to_i
w = w.to_i
p = p.to_i
n = n.to_i
result = minimumPasses(m, w, p, n)
puts result
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    m_temp <- getLine
    let m_t = words m_temp
    let m = read $ m_t!!0 :: Int
    let w = read $ m_t!!1 :: Int
    let p = read $ m_t!!2 :: Int
    let n = read $ m_t!!3 :: Int

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Help Karl determine the number of passes necessary to make $n$ candies in CandyMaker.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
    let [
      m_temp (read-line) 
      m_t (split m_temp #"\s+") 
      m (Integer/parseInt (m_t 0)) 
      w (Integer/parseInt (m_t 1)) 
      p (Integer/parseInt (m_t 2)) 
      n (Integer/parseInt (m_t 3)) 
    ]

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [M,W,P,N]} = io:fread("", "~d~d~d~d"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.body_html:
Karl loves playing games on social networking sites. His current favorite is CandyMaker, where the goal is to make candies.

Karl just started a level in which he must make candies using machines and workers. In a single pass, he can make candies; after each pass, he can decide whether to spend some of his candies to buy more machines or hire more workers. Buying a machine or hiring a worker costs units of candies, and there is no limit to the number of machines he can build or workers he can hire.

Karl wants to maximize his score by making all candies in a minimum number of passes. Can you find and print the minimum number of passes required for Karl to make at least units of candies?

Input Format

A single line consisting of four space-separated integers describing the respective values of (the number of machines), (the number of workers), (the price of buying one machine or hiring one worker), and (the number of candies Karl must make).

Constraints

Output Format

Print the minimum number of passes required to make at least candies.

Sample Input

3 1 2 12

Sample Output

3

Explanation

Karl makes three passes:

  1. In the first pass, he makes candies. He then spends of them hiring another worker, so and he has one candy left over.
  2. In the second pass, he makes candies. He spends of them on another machine and another worker, so and and he has candies left over.
  3. In the third pass, Karl makes candies. Because this satisfies his goal of making at least candies, we print the number of passes (i.e., ) as our answer.
